intro: Richardella salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaved richardella, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, willow-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
